text.p: UK engineering group Rolls-Royce Plc said on Tuesday it had won an order with a potential value of $240 million for RB211-535 engines to power up to 16 additional Continental Airlines Boeing 757 aircraft.
Rolls-Royce said that if all options were exercised, it would give Continental a Rolls-Royce powered 757 fleet of 41 aircraft.
Included in the deal is a repair and overhaul agreement between Continental and Rolls-Royce Canada which will provide the airline with a comprehensive eight-year support package.

The agreement also includes the purchase of over $45 million in spare engines from Rolls-Royce Capital and Rolls-Royce Commercial Aero Engines. That element is part of the $240 million potential value of the deal.

"This order is significant for two reasons," said John Cheffins, managing director of Rolls-Royce Commercial Aero Engines. "It expands our relationship with a valued customer, and it adds Micronesia, a Continental affiliate, as yet another new operator of the 535 engine." ($ = 0.609 British Pounds)
